EnumItem.Name: SdscomVersionEnum
EnumItem.Comments: The version of the XML standard which is applied in the transmission of datasheet information. This enum must list all compatible versions, but not any older ones! See issue #89. It is used to reference the version number in the XML data file, as the schema name does not include the version number. So this complements the version attribute in the xs:schema tag of the XSD files, and one of the enum values here must match the version attribute in the schema.

EnumItem.Name: LanguageCodeEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Language according to ISO standard ISO 639-1 (2 letters).

EnumItem.Name: CountryCodeEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Country according to ISO standard ISO 3166 (2 letters).

EnumItem.Name: RoleDescriptionEnum
EnumItem.Comments: The role values of a contact. Used in field Role. Role definitions are compatible with Norwegian SDScom applications.

EnumItem.Name: CompositionTypeEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Legal view on the composition, to determine whether the product is a substance, mixture, or else. Polymer is included for compatibility with Iuclid6 picklist N08.

EnumItem.Name: QualifierEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Symbols like less than, greater than, equal, greater or equal,less or equal or circa.

EnumItem.Name: DoseEnum
EnumItem.Comments: The legal values for the DoseEnum.

EnumItem.Name: ExposureRouteEnum
EnumItem.Comments: The legal values for the ExposureRouteEnum.

EnumItem.Name: ExposureLimitValueTypeEnum
EnumItem.Comments: The legal codes for the ExposureLimitValueTypeEnum. Source: Chapter 8. DE: AGW / ES: VLA / NL: MAC / UK: WEL / EC: OEL, TWA, STEL / FR: VLE / HU: AK, PK, MK / US: PEL / CH: MAK / PL: NDS, NDSCH, NDSP / DK: GV / SE: NGV, TGV, KTV / NO: AN, ADN / FI: HTP

EnumItem.Name: PhValueStateEnum
EnumItem.Comments: The legal codes for the PhValueStateEnum. Source: Chapter 9.

EnumItem.Name: PhNotRelevantEnum
EnumItem.Comments: This type corresponds directly to Iuclid Picklist PH_1 nd is relevant e.g. for PCN notifications in Europe. Enumeration values are taken literally from this list to facilitate mapping.
EnumItem.Values: pH is below -3,pH is above 15,substance/mixture is a gas,substance/mixture is non-polar/aprotic,substance/mixture is non-soluble (in water),substance/mixture not stable,substance/mixture reacts with water

EnumItem.Name: ViscosityTypeEnum
EnumItem.Comments: The legal codes for the ViscosityTypeEnum. Source: Chapter 9.

EnumItem.Name: SolubilityMediumEnum
EnumItem.Comments: The legal codes for the SolubilityMediumEnum. Source: Chapter 9.

EnumItem.Name: StateUnderStandardConditionsEnum
EnumItem.Comments: physical state (only solid/liquid/gaseous) under standard conditions (20°C, 1013 hpa)

EnumItem.Name: UnitEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Sensible values for units in various contexts. SI units are used where available, and no super/subsets (i.e. 3 instead of ³)
EnumItem.Values: °C,°F,µg/Animal,µg/cm3,µg/dL,µg/g,µg/kg,µg/L,µg/mg,µg/mL,µg/mmol,µg/mol,µg,µL/g,µL/kg,µL/L,µL/m3,µL/mg,µL/mL,µL/mmol,µL/mol,µm,µmol/L,µmol/mol,µPa.s,%,1/K,1/mol.s,1/W,A.h,A,a,atm,bar.m/s,bar/s,bar,Bq,C,cal/kg,cal/mol.K,cal/mol,cal,cd,Ci,cL,cm/d,cm/h,cm/min,cm/s,cm2,cm3/g,cm3/h,cm3/min,cm3/s,cm3,cm,cP,cSt,d,dL,dm2,dm3,dm,dyn/cm,F,fiber/cm3,fiber/m3,fiber/mL,fm,g O2/g,g O2/L,g/cm3,g/dm3,g/g,g/h,g/kg,g/L.s,g/L,g/m3,g/m,g/min,g/mL,g/mol,g/s,g,Gbq,h,hPa/s,hPa,J/kg,J/mol,J,K/min,K,kA.h,kcal/kg,kcal/mol,kcal,kg/dm3,kg/h,kg/ha,kg/L,kg/m3,kg/min,kg/mol,kg/s.m2,kg/s,kg,kJ/kg,kJ/mol,kJ,km/d,km/h,kPa/s,kPa,kV,kW,L/h,L/kg.h,L/kg.min,L/kg.s,L/kg,L/L,L/m3,L/min,L/mol,L/s,L,lm,lx,m/d,m/h,m/min,m/s,m2,m3/h,m3/min,m3/s,m3,m,mA,mbar,mCi,mg C/g,mg C/L,mg KOH/g,mg O2/g,mg O2/L,mg/Animal,mg/cm2,mg/cm3,mg/dm2,mg/dm3,mg/Eye,mg/g,mg/h,mg/kg bw.d,mg/kg bw,mg/kg,mg/L,mg/m3,mg/mg,mg/min,mg/mL,mg/mmol,mg/mol,mg/s,mg,min,mJ,mL/Animal,mL/Eye,mL/g,mL/h,mL/kg,mL/L,mL/m3,mL/mg,mL/min,mL/mL,mL/mmol,mL/mol,mL/s,mL,mm H2O,mm Hg,mm/a,mm/d,mm/h,mm/min,mm/s,mm2/s,mm2,mm3,mm,mmol/g,mmol/kg,mmol/L,mmol/m3,mmol/mg,mmol/mL,mmol/mmol,mmol/mol,mN/m,mol-%,mol/g,mol/kg,mol/L.s,mol/L,mol/m3,mol/mg,mol/mL,mol/mmol,mol/mol,mPa.s,mPa,ms,mV,N/cm2,N/m2,N/m,N/mm2,ng/cm3,ng/g,ng/L,ng/mg,ng/mL,ng/mmol,ng/mol,nm,nmol/L,P,Pa.m3/mol,Pa.s,Pa/s,Pa,pm,ppb,ppm,ppq,ppt,S,s,St,t/h,t/min,t/s,t,Torr,U/g,U/kg,U/L,U/mg,U/mL,U/mmol,U/mol,V,Vol-%,W.h,W.m,W,Wb,Weight-%

EnumItem.Name: ReasonForWaiving
EnumItem.Comments: For physical or chemical properties, reasons for waiving are: 1. cannot be determined = technically impossible to obtain (pH value for solids, arguably) 2. not applicable = irrelevant (because no hazard assessment requires such info) 3. no data = unknown (not tested so far) Implemented for https://github.com/esdscom/sdscom-xml/issues/33

EnumItem.Name: TemperatureClassEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Legal values for the TemperatureClassEnum. Source: Chapter 9.

EnumItem.Name: GasGroupEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Legal values for the GasGroupEnum. Source: Chapter 9.

EnumItem.Name: SdscomSubsetEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Legal values for the XMLStandardSubsetEnum. It should specify the minimum requirements matched, i.e. any subset with full coverage of SDScomChem should pick SDScomChem. SdscomXml light is a Norwegian specification, SDScomBau and SDScomChem are German, full means complete SDS information, other means any non-standard subset.

EnumItem.Name: PackingGroupEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Legal values for the PackingGroupEnum

EnumItem.Name: JustificationForUpdateEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Enumeration for structured communication of SDS changes, consistent with Iuclid6 PG6-60571 v1.0 (Justifications for update) for CLP article 45 notification: 64936 change in composition of the mixture (addition, deletion, substitution of component) 64937 change in composition of the mixture (change in the concentration range) 64938 change in composition of the mixture (change in the exact concentration) 64939 change in the mixture classification 64940 change in the product identifier 64941 new toxicological information available 1342 other

EnumItem.Name: FormEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Form as specified in Iuclid6 Picklist A101 v3.0: A101 - v3.0 – Mixture form 60037 aerosol dispenser: not specified 60038 aerosol dispenser: foam aerosol 60039 aerosol dispenser: spray aerosol 2830 gas 60040 gas: vapour 60041 gas under pressure: compressed gas 60042 gas under pressure: dissolved gas 60043 gas under pressure: liquefied gas 60044 gas under pressure: refrigerated liquefied gas 64931 cream / paste 5994 foam 6003 gel 2038 liquid 60048 liquid: viscous 60049 liquid: volatile 60045 liquid - liquid: emulsion 60047 liquid - solid: mixture of 60050 semi-solid (amorphous): gel 2381 solid 61424 solid: bulk 60051 solid: compact 60052 solid: crystalline 60053 solid: fibres 60054 solid: filaments 60055 solid: flakes 60056 solid: granular 60058 solid: particulate/powder 60057 solid: pellets 64932 solid: pressed powder 61861 solid: nanomaterial, surface-treated 61862 solid: nanomaterial, no surface treatment 60059 solid: nanomaterial 64933 solid: tabs / tablets 60062 solid - liquid: aqueous solution 60063 solid - liquid: suspension 60064 solid - solid: alloy 1342 other
EnumItem.Values: aerosol dispenser: not specified,aerosol dispenser: foam aerosol,aerosol dispenser: spray aerosol,gas,gas: vapour,gas under pressure: compressed gas,gas under pressure: dissolved gas,gas under pressure: liquefied gas,gas under pressure: refrigerated liquefied gas,cream / paste,foam,gel,liquid,liquid: viscous,liquid: volatile,liquid - liquid: emulsion,liquid - solid: mixture of,semi-solid (amorphous): gel,solid,solid: bulk,solid: compact,solid: crystalline,solid: fibres,solid: filaments,solid: flakes,solid: granular,solid: particulate/powder,solid: pellets,solid: pressed powder,solid: nanomaterial, surface-treated,solid: nanomaterial, no surface treatment,solid: nanomaterial,solid: tabs / tablets,solid - liquid: aqueous solution,solid - liquid: suspension,solid - solid: alloy,other

EnumItem.Name: ColourEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Colour as described in Iuclid6 picklist PG6-60569 v1.0 – Mixture colour 64912 colourless 64913 black 64914 blue 64915 brown 64916 gold 64917 green 64918 grey 64919 orange 64920 pink 64921 purple 64922 red 64923 silver 64924 violet 64925 white 64926 yellow 64927 multicolour (select all relevant colours) 64928 mixture containing generic product identifier ‘colouring agent’ (select all relevant colours)

EnumItem.Name: ColourIntensityEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Colour intensity as specified in Iuclid6 picklist PG6-60568 v1.0 – Mixture colour intensity: 64908 transparent [should be translucent, as transparent means colourless) 64909 light 64910 dark 64911 fluorescent

EnumItem.Name: PackagingTypeEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Type of Packaging as specified in Iuclid6 picklist B05 v2.0: 58353 aerosol can 58354 airspray 64859 atomizer 58355 bag / sack 58356 baitbox 58357 blister 58358 bottle 58359 box 64861 brick 64862 bucket 58360 can / tin 64863 carboy 58361 case 64864 dispenser 58362 dropper 58363 drum 64865 envelope 58364 IBC (intermediate bulk container) 64866 jar 58365 jerry can 64867 jug 58366 packet 58367 sachet 64868 phial 64869 stick 64870 syringe 58368 talcum powder container 64871 tank 58369 tea bag (product disperses through the container when added to water) 64872 tube 58370 water soluble bag 1342 other:
EnumItem.Values: aerosol can,airspray,atomizer,bag / sack,baitbox,blister,bottle,box,brick,bucket,can / tin,carboy,case,dispenser,dropper,drum,envelope,IBC (intermediate bulk container),jar,jerry can,jug,packet,sachet,phial,stick,syringe,talcum powder container,tank,tea bag (product disperses through the container when added to water),tube,water soluble bag,other

EnumItem.Name: PackagingMaterialEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Material as specified in Iuclid6 picklist B07: 58378 glass 58379 plastic: HDPE 58380 plastic: LDPE 58381 plastic: PET 58382 plastic: composite: 58383 metal: 58384 paper, cardboard 1342 other:
EnumItem.Values: glass,plastic: HDPE,plastic: LDPE,plastic: PET,plastic: composite,metal,paper, cardboard,other

EnumItem.Name: SubstanceTypeEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Substance type as represented in Iuclid6 picklist N58: 1756 element 2003 inorganic 1334 organic 2240 organometallic 2262 petroleum product 1342 other:

EnumItem.Name: FormulationTypeEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Formulation Type as represented in Iuclid6 picklist B04 v1.0: 58439 AE Aerosol dispenser 58440 AL Any other liquid 58441 AP Any other powder 58442 BR Briquette 58443 CB Bait concentrate 58444 CL Contact liquid or gel 58445 CP Contact powder 58446 CS Capsule suspension 58447 DC Dispersible concentrate 58448 DP Dustable powder 58449 DT Tablet for direct application 58450 EC Emulsifiable concentrate 58451 EG Emulsifiable granule 58452 EO Emulsion, water in oil 58453 EP Emulsifiable powder 58454 EW Emulsion, oil in water 58455 FU Smoke generator 58456 GA Gas 58457 GE Gas generating product 58458 GL Emulsifiable gel 58459 GR Granule 58460 GS Grease 58461 GW Water soluble gel 58462 HN Hot fogging concentrate 58463 KK Combi-pack solid/liquid 58464 KL Combi-pack liquid/liquid 58465 KN Cold fogging concentrate 58466 LN Long-lasting insecticidal net 58467 LV Liquid vaporizer 58468 MC Mosquito coil 58469 ME Micro-emulsion 58470 MV Vaporizing mats 58471 OD Oil dispersion 58472 OF Oil miscible flowable concentrate (oil miscible suspension) 58473 OL Oil miscible liquid 58474 OP Oil dispersible powder 58475 PA Paste 58476 PC Gel or paste concentrate 58477 PO Pour-on 58478 RB Bait (ready for use) 58479 SA Spot-on 58480 SC Suspension concentrate (= flowable concentrate) 58481 SD Suspension concentrate for direct application 58482 SE Suspo-emulsion 58483 SG Water soluble granule 58484 SL Soluble concentrate 58485 SO Spreading oil 58486 SP Water soluble powder 58487 ST Water soluble tablet 58488 SU Ultra-low volume (ULV) suspension 58489 TB Tablet 58490 TC Technical material 58491 TK Technical concentrate 58492 UL Ultra-low volume (ULV) liquid 58493 VP Vapour releasing product 58494 WG Water dispersible granules 58495 WP Wettable powder 58496 WT Water dispersible tablet 58497 ZC A mixed formulation of CS and SC 58498 ZE A mixed formulation of CS and SE 58499 ZW A mixed formulation of CS and EW 58500 XX Others:

EnumItem.Name: ComponentFunctionEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Function of a component according to Iuclid6 picklists N28 and N28A (map "stabilizer" to "stabilizer: other"): 2675 absorbent 1699 active substance 2680 adsorbent 2693 anticaking agent 2694 anticoagulant 2721 booster 2728 buffer 2752 coagulant 2753 coating agent 2756 colourant 2761 complexing agent 2763 conditioner 2768 controlled release agent 2772 crystal growth regulator 2781 dehydrating agent 2783 denaturant 2794 drying agent 2795 dye 2802 emulsifier 2819 filler 2823 flow aid agent 2824 fragrance 2847 hardener 2895 lubricant 2918 moisturiser 2937 neutraliser 2976 odour masking agent 3442 pH adjuster 2999 pigment 3026 propellant 3342 solvent 61432 stabiliser: antioxidant 61433 stabiliser: inhibitor 61434 stabiliser: UV absorber 61435 stabiliser: other 3350 stiffener 3400 UV absorber 3424 viscosity modifier 3426 water repellent 3429 wetting agent 1342 other:

EnumItem.Name: ReasonForWaiving
EnumItem.Comments: For physical or chemical properties, reasons for waiving are: 1. cannot be determined = technically impossible to obtain (pH value for solids, arguably) 2. not applicable = irrelevant (because no hazard assessment requires such info) 3. no data = unknown (not tested so far) Implemented for https://github.com/esdscom/sdscom-xml/issues/33

EnumItem.Name: ReasonForWaiving
EnumItem.Comments: For physical or chemical properties, reasons for waiving are: 1. cannot be determined = technically impossible to obtain (pH value for solids, arguably) 2. not applicable = irrelevant (because no hazard assessment requires such info) 3. no data = unknown (not tested so far) Implemented for https://github.com/esdscom/sdscom-xml/issues/33

EnumItem.Name: Ghs02PrecautionGeneral
EnumItem.Comments: The original UN GHS (2003) had no harmonized Precautionary Statements, and GHS Revision 1 (2005) had no numbering for Precautionary Statements. Thus, SDScom implements Precautionary Statements with GHS Revision 2 (2007).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassExpl
EnumItem.Comments: Explosive categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs01ClassExpl
EnumItem.Comments: Explosives according to UN GHS Revision 1 (2005).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassFlamGas
EnumItem.Comments: Flammable Gas categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs04ClassChemUnstGas
EnumItem.Comments: Chemically Unstable Gas categories according to UN GHS revision 4 (2011). This is officially part of Flam. Gas., but must be applied in addition where applicable.
EnumItem.Values: Chem. Unst. Gas A,Chem. Unst. Gas B

EnumItem.Name: Ghs06ClassPyrGas
EnumItem.Comments: Pyrophoric Gas categories according to UN GHS revision 6 (2015). This is officially part of Flam. Gas., but must be applied in addition where applicable.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs07ClassFlamGas
EnumItem.Comments: Flammable Gas categories according to UN GHS Revision 7 (2017). Although part of category 1A, the only official abbreviation (in annex VI of the European CLP) chooses a wording which looks like different categories or even classes.
EnumItem.Values: Flam. Gas 1A,Flam. Gas 1B,Flam. Gas 2,Pyr. Gas,Chem. Unstab. Gas A,Chem. Unstab. Gas B

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassFlamAer
EnumItem.Comments: Flammable Aerosol categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs04ClassAerosol
EnumItem.Comments: Aerosol categories according to UN GHS revision 4 (2011).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs04HazardAerosol
EnumItem.Comments: While Precautionary statements are combined with a plus sign, Aerosol categories carry two separate Hazard statements - an exception within GHS.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs08ClassAerosolPressChem
EnumItem.Comments: Aerosols And Chemicals Under Pressure categories (one common hazard class!) according to UN GHS revision 8 (2019).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs08HazardAerosolPressChem
EnumItem.Comments: While Precautionary statements are combined with a plus sign, Aerosol categories carry two separate Hazard statements - an exception within GHS.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs08PrecautionAerosolPressChem
EnumItem.Comments: For Chemicals Under Pressure in transportable cylinders, P410 may be omitted. Thus P403 is added in this list.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassOxGas
EnumItem.Comments: Oxidizing Gas categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassPressGas
EnumItem.Comments: Gases Under Pressure categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).
EnumItem.Values: Press. Gas,Press. Gas (Comp.),Press. Gas (Liq.),Press. Gas (Ref. Liq.),Press. Gas (Diss.)

EnumItem.Name: Ghs02PrecautionPressGas
EnumItem.Comments: For Gases Under Pressure in transportable cylinders, P410 may be omitted. Thus P403 is added in this list.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs05PrecautionPressGas
EnumItem.Comments: For Gases Under Pressure in transportable cylinders, P410 may be omitted. Thus P403 is added in this list.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassFlamLiq
EnumItem.Comments: Flammable Liquids categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassFlamLiq_no4
EnumItem.Comments: Flammable Liquids categories according to the original UN GHS (2003), without category 4.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassFlamSol
EnumItem.Comments: Flammable Solids categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassSelfReact
EnumItem.Comments: Self-reactive categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).
EnumItem.Values: Self-react. A,Self-react. B,Self-react. C,Self-react. CD,Self-react. D,Self-react. E,Self-react. EF,Self-react. F,Self-react. G

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassPyrLiq
EnumItem.Comments: Pyrophoric Liquids categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassPyrSol
EnumItem.Comments: Pyrophoric Solids categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassSelfHeat
EnumItem.Comments: Self-heating categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassWaterReact
EnumItem.Comments: Water-reactive categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassOxLiq
EnumItem.Comments: Oxidizing Liquids categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassOxSol
EnumItem.Comments: Oxidizing Solids categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassOrgPerox
EnumItem.Comments: Organic Peroxides categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).
EnumItem.Values: Org. Perox. A,Org. Perox. B,Org. Perox. C,Org. Perox. CD,Org. Perox. D,Org. Perox. E,Org. Perox. EF,Org. Perox. F,Org. Perox. G

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassMetCorr
EnumItem.Comments: Metal Corrosion categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs06ClassDesensExpl
EnumItem.Comments: Desensitized Explosives categories according to UN GHS revision 6 (2015).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassAcuteToxOral
EnumItem.Comments: Acute Toxicity by oral intake categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).
EnumItem.Values: Acute Tox. 1 (oral),Acute Tox. 2 (oral),Acute Tox. 3 (oral),Acute Tox. 4 (oral),Acute Tox. 5 (oral)

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassAcuteToxOral_no5
EnumItem.Comments: Acute Toxicity by oral intake categories according to the original UN GHS (2003), without category 5.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassAcuteToxDermal
EnumItem.Comments: Acute Toxicity by dermal contact categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).
EnumItem.Values: Acute Tox. 1 (dermal),Acute Tox. 2 (dermal),Acute Tox. 3 (dermal),Acute Tox. 4 (dermal),Acute Tox. 5 (dermal)

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassAcuteToxDermal_no5
EnumItem.Comments: Acute Toxicity by dermal contact categories according to the original UN GHS (2003), without category 5.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassAcuteToxInhal
EnumItem.Comments: Acute Toxicity by inhalation categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).
EnumItem.Values: Acute Tox. 1 (inhalation),Acute Tox. 2 (inhalation),Acute Tox. 3 (inhalation),Acute Tox. 4 (inhalation),Acute Tox. 5 (inhalation)

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassAcuteToxInhal_no5
EnumItem.Comments: Acute Toxicity by inhalation categories according to the original UN GHS (2003), without category 5.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassSkinCorr
EnumItem.Comments: Skin Corrosion/Irritiation categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).
EnumItem.Values: Skin Corr. 1,Skin Corr. 1A,Skin Corr. 1B,Skin Corr. 1C,Skin Irrit. 2,Skin Irrit. 3

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassSkinCorr_no3
EnumItem.Comments: Skin Corrosion/Irritiation categories according to the original UN GHS (2003), without category 3.
EnumItem.Values: Skin Corr. 1,Skin Corr. 1A,Skin Corr. 1B,Skin Corr. 1C,Skin Irrit. 2

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassEyeDam
EnumItem.Comments: Eye Damage/Irritation categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassRespSens
EnumItem.Comments: Respiratory tract sensitizer categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs02ClassRespSens
EnumItem.Comments: Respiratory tract sensitizer categories according to UN GHS revision 2 (2007).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs03ClassRespSens
EnumItem.Comments: Respiratory tract sensitizer categories according to UN GHS revision 3 (2009).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassSkinSens
EnumItem.Comments: Skin Sensitizer categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs02ClassSkinSens
EnumItem.Comments: Skin Sensitizer categories according to UN GHS revision 2 (2007).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs03ClassSkinSens
EnumItem.Comments: Skin Sensitizer categories according to UN GHS revision 3 (2009).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassMuta
EnumItem.Comments: Mutagenicity categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassCarc
EnumItem.Comments: Carcinogenicity categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassRepr
EnumItem.Comments: Flammable Solids categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassLact
EnumItem.Comments: Lactatioon effects category (offically a subcategory of Repr) according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassStotSe
EnumItem.Comments: STOT single exposure categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs01ClassStotSe3
EnumItem.Comments: STOT single exposure category 3 according to UN GHS revision 1 (2005). Officially a part of STOT SE, but can be applied independently from STOT SE 1 and 2 as it describes different effects.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassStotRe
EnumItem.Comments: STOT repreated exposure categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs01ClassAspTox
EnumItem.Comments: Aspiration hazard categories according to UN GHS revision 1 (2005).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs01ClassAspTox_no2
EnumItem.Comments: Aspiration hazard categories according to UN GHS revision 1 (2005), without category 2.

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassAquaticAcute
EnumItem.Comments: Acute Aquatic environmental hazard categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).
EnumItem.Values: Aquatic Acute I,Aquatic Acute II,Aquatic Acute III

EnumItem.Name: Ghs01ClassAquaticAcute
EnumItem.Comments: Acute Aquatic environmental hazard categories according to UN GHS revision 1 (2005).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs01ClassAquaticAcute_no23
EnumItem.Comments: Acute Aquatic environmental hazard categories according to UN GHS revision 1 (2005).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs00ClassAquaticChronic
EnumItem.Comments: Chronic Aquatic environmental hazard categories according to the original UN GHS (2003).
EnumItem.Values: Aquatic Chronic I,Aquatic Chronic II,Aquatic Chronic III,Aquatic Chronic IV

EnumItem.Name: Ghs01ClassAquaticChronic
EnumItem.Comments: Chronic Aquatic environmental hazard categories according to UN GHS revision 1 (2005).

EnumItem.Name: Ghs03ClassOzone
EnumItem.Comments: Ozone layer hazard categories according to UN GHS revision 3 (2009).

EnumItem.Name: GhsPictogramCodeEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Pictogram code enumeration with a predefined set of legal values.

EnumItem.Name: GhsSignalWordEnum
EnumItem.Comments: Signal word enumeration with a predefined set of legal values.

EnumItem.Name: VbfClass
EnumItem.Comments: see https://www.arbeitsinspektion.gv.at/Arbeitsstoffe/brandgefaehrliche_Arbeitsstoffe/Lagerung_brennbarer_Fluessigkeiten.html
EnumItem.Values: A I,A II,A III,B I,B II

EnumItem.Name: VbfClass
EnumItem.Comments: see https://www.arbeitsinspektion.gv.at/Arbeitsstoffe/brandgefaehrliche_Arbeitsstoffe/Lagerung_brennbarer_Fluessigkeiten.html
EnumItem.Values: A I,A II,A III,B I,B II

EnumItem.Name: Whmis2015ClassCategoryEnumRestr
EnumItem.Comments: This type restricts GHS revision 3 to the classes and categories which are covered in WHMIS. Since environmental hazards are optional, they are not excluded here. In theory, WHMIS is based on GHS revision 5 and then rolled back to be "compatible" with GHS revision 3, in order to be consistent with the USA. We are treating it as rev. 3 to make SDScom easier to read.
EnumItem.Values: Acute Tox. 5 (oral),Acute Tox. 5 (dermal),Acute Tox. 5 (inhalation),Skin Irrit. 3,Asp. Tox. 2

EnumItem.Comments: Canada specific hazard classes

EnumItem.Name: ESSection2Head
EnumItem.Comments: Specifies the sub headers of section 2 for exposure scenarios: AFD: Amount used (or contained in articles), frequency and duration of use/exposure AGPA: Additional good practice advice OOC: Other conditions PC: Product (article) characteristics PPE: Conditions and measures related to personal protection, hygiene and health evaluation STP: Conditions and measures related to sewage treatment plant TOM: Technical and organizational conditions and measures WASTE: Conditions and measures related to treatment of waste (incl. article waste)

EnumItem.Name: ESSectionSubHeader
EnumItem.Comments: Defines the abbreviations of headings of section 2 for the exposure scenario for communication.

EnumItem.Name: ReachRoleDescriptionEnum
EnumItem.Comments: The role values of a contact as defined under REACH. Used in field Role. See issue #18.
